image.altText: A large open cut mine

props.synopsis: Core Lithium has suspended mining operations at its Finniss lithium project near Darwin amid "weak market conditions", with up to half of the site's 300 jobs set to be lost.

title.children: Up to 150 job cuts expected as Core Lithium suspends mining at Darwin site

image.altText: Josh Hazlewood leaps to punch the air after taking a wicket

props.synopsis: Australia tears through Pakistan's batting line-up late on day three at the SCG, but still trails by 82 as the tourists reach stumps 7-68 in their second innings.

title.children: Australia shreds Pakistan batting line-up as 11 wickets fall in final session at SCG

image.altText: Saim Ayub flips upside down

props.synopsis: A "ridiculous" stoppage had the commentators incredulous, while Pakistan had a disaster in the field. Here are five quick hits from day three at the SCG.

title.children: Five quick hits — a 'ridiculous' stoppage and outfield disasters at the SCG

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann walking into court.

props.synopsis: Final submissions released by the Federal Court in Bruce Lehrmann's defamation action against Network Ten and Lisa Wilkinson outline fresh attacks on the credibilities of Mr Lehrmann and Brittany Higgins.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann's lawyers say he is entitled to damages even if defamation trial judge finds sexual activity occurred with Brittany Higgins

image.altText: Jeffrey Epstein appears in court.

props.synopsis: About 300 new pages of unsealed documents have been released, delving deeper into the decades of alleged abuse the financier inflicted upon teenage girls and young women.

title.children: Second batch of unsealed documents related to financier Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse released

image.altText: An angry tennis player sits in her chair at a change of ends, as she points her finger towards the umpire (out of shot).

props.synopsis: Veteran Victoria Azarenka needs her entire armoury to take down Jelena Ostapenko and puts herself in the frame for a third Brisbane International title — but only after her Latvian opponent blows up at the umpire for a non-call.

title.children: 'You ruin my matches!': Ostapenko blows up at umpire in epic Brisbane loss to Azarenka

image.altText: A young man stands in front of a print.

props.synopsis: Based in the tiny Indigenous community of Nauiyu, in one of the most remote corners of Australia, Kieren Karritpul is one of a select few artists from Australia who have been invited to exhibit their work at Colomboscope.

title.children: 'My dreams came true': Remote artist Kieren Karritpul to exhibit at international art festival

props.synopsis: A small-town mother found dead in her home, her disabled daughter missing — as Gypsy Rose Blanchard walks free, this is what we know about the decades of abuse, lies and manipulation leading up to her arrest.

title.children: The world thought Gypsy Rose Blanchard was brain damaged and dying. Four words on Facebook were the first clue to the truth

image.altText: Steve Smith prepares to run onto the field next to an Australian flag

props.synopsis: As the SCG Test hurtles towards a climax, Australia's focus has already turned to what lies ahead — the many pivotal decisions and significant challenges it will soon face.

title.children: Steve Smith the opener? The decision that could define Australia's move to a next generation

image.altText: Kim Jong Un stands with his daughter in front of a transport erector.

props.synopsis: South Korea says North Korea has conducted artillery drills along their sea boundary in violation of a 2018 military agreement.

title.children: Two South Korean islands evacuated as North Korea fires into the sea, South Korean military says

image.altText: US President Donald Trump, left, shakes hands with Chinese President Xi Jinping.

props.synopsis: Mr Trump continued to profit from foreign governments while he was US president, with businesses tied to him receiving at least $11.6 million in foreign payments from 20 countries during his four years in the White House

title.children: Donald Trump received millions from China and other foreign governments while president, report finds

image.altText: A shirtless man in shorts on the floor surrounded by police. His face is blurred out.

props.synopsis: The woman was treated by paramedics at the Coffs Harbour care home before being taken to hospital with minor injuries and is now in the care of her family. Police have charged a 29-year-old man over the alleged attack.

title.children: Police say alleged sex attack on 76yo aged care resident 'horrendous' as man faces court

image.altText: Laura Haworth, missing since 2008.

props.synopsis: Canberrans and visitors to the annual Summernats car festival are being urged to think back to January 5, 2008 and whether they remember anything that might shed light on the whereabouts of missing woman Laura Haworth.

title.children: Laura Haworth has not been seen for 16 years. Police think Canberra's Summernats community could crack the case

image.altText: Oscar Pistorius in a suit and tie is escorted by police through media outside a court

props.synopsis: Former South African Paralympic star Oscar Pistorius is released on parole, nearly 11 years after murdering his girlfriend Reeva Steenkamp in a crime that shocked a nation long inured to violence against women.

title.children: 'Blade Runner' Oscar Pistorius released from prison 11 years after murdering girlfriend

image.altText: The Cockle Train stopped on the line after a pedestrian was hit.

props.synopsis: The death of an 87-year-old American tourist along the heritage railway line on the outskirts of Victor Harbor prompts calls for more signage at crossing points, but the company which operates the trains and the SA government say they believe existing warnings are adequate.

title.children: American tourist's Cockle Train death triggers signage concerns, but premier satisfied with rail safety

image.altText: Caravan wreck on river bank

props.synopsis: A NSW council says unregulated camping on private land was a disaster waiting to happen, after more than a dozen campers were caught out by rising floodwaters.

title.children: Campers rescued from floods had 'no idea' they were in a danger zone. Is more regulation needed?

image.altText: A fisheries officer counts marron in two plastic tubs.

props.synopsis: The government says tight management rules are in place because marron, a native freshwater crayfish species, is susceptible to being overfished, as 13 people in the state's South West face prosecution over an alleged catch of 285.

title.children: Alleged catch of prized delicacy leaves 13 people facing prosecution in Western Australia

image.altText: Two side by side images of a large crocodile in a creek

props.synopsis: Rangers on Queensland's Capricorn Coast investigate a "dangerous" crocodile that has given a fisherman a fright, after spending weeks lurking the area and putting locals on high alert.

title.children: 'Watch your back': 2.5-metre croc launches itself onto pontoon in front of fisherman

image.altText: A truck laying on its side on the side of a highway.

props.synopsis: A two-truck crash on the Dukes Highway in South Australia leaves sheep roaming the roadside, and nearby residents calling for more lanes.

title.children: Livestock truck rollover on highway where 'everyone has a horror story' prompts fresh call for lane duplication

image.altText: David Warner wearing his baggy green cap during the Boxing Day Test in 2023.

props.synopsis: David Warner is reunited with his baggy green cap after he announced it had gone missing ahead of his final Test appearance for Australia.

title.children: 'I'll cherish this for the rest of my life': David Warner's missing baggy green cap found

image.altText: A wide shot of a crowd of nurses at a rally holding up signs and placards with tall CBD buildings behind them.

props.synopsis: WA's nurses and midwives reluctantly conclude their long-running battle with the state government over pay and conditions, with union members voting to accept one of two offers put to them.

title.children: Nurses and midwives reluctantly accept WA government pay deal

image.altText: Lightning strike on the Gold Coast

props.synopsis: It is expected to cost more than $2 billion to recover from back-to-back natural disasters that hit Queensland in recent weeks, with the south-east accounting for three quarters of the total damage bill.

title.children: The scale of the storm disaster in Queensland's south-east is massive and continues to grow. Here's what we know so far

image.altText: Sunny weather, bushfires and storms in 2023

props.synopsis: Last year may have been the world's hottest at a global level but Australia's was comparatively subdued after recording its equal eighth warmest on record, according the Bureau of Meteorology's annual climate statement for 2023.

title.children: How did Australia's 2023 weather stack up against the rest of the world?

image.altText: A person in winter clothing walks up a road covered in snow during a snowstorm in Kristiansand, Norway

props.synopsis: Extremely cold temperatures, snow and gale-force winds wreak havoc across the Nordic region, while heavy rain continues to cause more flooding in Germany, France and the Netherlands.

title.children: Extreme cold leaves thousands without power in northern Europe as floods persist in Germany and France

image.altText: Three sculptures of green aliens with large black eyes in a museum

props.synopsis: What began as a craze in the 1940s became the subject of a secret US government program. Here's why politicians and scientists have started to take UFOs seriously.

title.children: 'Nothing has been the same since': Why is the US government taking UFOs so seriously?

image.altText: Queen Margrethe sits in a carriage and waves her hand

props.synopsis: Queen Margrethe II of Denmark has taken her final official ride as monarch in the traditional golden carriage ahead of her abdication set for January 14.

title.children: Denmark's queen makes one last public appearance before stepping down in a rare abdication

image.altText: a woman sits at a kitchen table with a cup of tea reading a stack of documents

props.synopsis: Fran Ross has never made a home and contents insurance claim and says her property isn't at significant risk of natural disasters. The Brisbane pensioner's premiums are still going up by close to 400 per cent.

title.children: 'Absolutely extreme': Pensioner 'sick to my stomach' as home and contents insurance premiums quadruple

image.altText: A night time photo of a Queensland Police Service car with its blue light illuminated.

props.synopsis: A 37-year-old man has died in police custody in Queensland's Moreton Bay.

title.children: Man pronounced dead in hospital after being detained in police custody

image.altText: Crime scene tape blocks off a home surrounded by police vehicles and staff

props.synopsis: Two people have been charged with murder following the death of a father of three at a home near Ipswich, west of Brisbane.

title.children: Queensland police allege father of three was killed in 'targeted and planned attack'

image.altText: Flames around some e-bikes inside a factory

props.synopsis: Residents raise the alarm as a blaze breaks out at a factory in Sydney's inner west, causing traffic disruption and power outages.

title.children: 'You could feel the heat around the corner': Massive blaze erupts in Sydney e-bike repair shop
